comments.body: Increasing this sleep duration to reduce the odds of runs that fit Keras models in these tests ending before we have a chance to log Spark datasource info. I can't seem to replicate this failure locally but I guess Spark on Travis is slow...

Can we add an explanatory comment here indicating why we're sleeping and that this is a known edge case (as documented here: https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.spark.html#mlflow.spark.autolog).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +38,42 @@    # is known and documented in
    # https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.spark.html#mlflow.spark.autolog
    time.sleep(5)
